segments.title: Conversational Vocabulary Introduction
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of conversational vocabulary, emphasizing its importance for basic communication. Uses an example of a confusing conversation about The Hunger Games to demonstrate how missing basic vocabulary makes speech incomprehensible.

segments.title: Location Vocabulary Words
segments.summary: Explains Spanish location words including este/esta/esto (this), ese/esa/eso (that), and aquel/aquella/aquello (that far away). Also covers how these words can be used for both location and time references.

segments.title: Numbers and Counting
segments.summary: Covers cardinal numbers (uno, dos, etc.) and ordinal numbers (primero, segundo, etc.) in Spanish. Explains how these can be used for listing items and indicating floor numbers.

segments.title: Question Words Overview
segments.summary: Introduces Spanish question words, noting their importance in conversation. Mentions that a deeper dive into question words will be covered in a future video.

segments.title: Common Courtesy Words
segments.summary: Covers basic courtesy words in Spanish including perdone/perdona (excuse me), hola (hi), and gracias (thank you). Explains the formal vs casual usage of certain terms.
